byline.contributor: Mia Li and Patrick Zuo contributed research.

abstract: Arrest and imprisonment of five feminist activists in China has started international backlash in support of women, despite Chinese authorities' attempts to hush story; crackdown on activists Li Tinting, Wei Tingting, Wu Rongrong, Wang Man and Zheng Churan is seen as indicator of increased crackdown on grassroots activism under Pres Xi Jinping.
lead_paragraph: The detention of five outspoken activists, part of an effort to quash the nascent feminist movement, is seen as a dismal milestone in the Communist Party’s war on grass-roots activism.

headline.main: Taking Feminist Battle to China’s Streets, and Landing in Jail
headline.print_headline: Taking Feminist Battle to China’s Streets, and Landing in Jail

snippet: The detention of five outspoken activists, part of an effort to quash the nascent feminist movement, is seen as a dismal milestone in the Communist Party’s war on grass-roots activism.
